#Example of change to CalCur_unbal data 
```{r}
  Cbase2 <-  base_list[[1]] # Base biomass, production, fishing, etc.
  Cdiet2 <- diet_list[[1]] # Diet matrix

  CalCur_unbal2 <- read.rpath.params(Cbase2, Cdiet2)
  CalCur_unbal2[[1]] <- CalCur_unbal2[[1]] %>%
    select(-X)
  CalCur_unbal2[[1]][93, 5] <- NA
  CalCur_unbal2[[1]][CalCur_unbal2[[1]] == -1] <- NA
   CalCur_unbal[[2]] <- CalCur_unbal[[2]] %>%
    select(-X)
  check.rpath.params(CalCur_unbal)
  CalCur_unbal
```

#Loop through 500 data sets!! 

#Reading in data, unbalanced model
```{r}
#HELP: need to check over this b/c when you run CalCur_unbal2 nothing goes, confused why 

#Define list, large list where each seperate model output you can call out of list, need to define CalCur_unbalanced outside of loop, creating a list in R, have to do it b/c you are indexing, filling different parts of object at a time
  for (i in 1:500) {
  Cbase2 <-  base_list[[i]] # Base biomass, production, fishing, etc.
  Cdiet2 <- diet_list[[i]] # Diet matrix

  #Edit the datasets
  CalCur_unbal2[[i]] <- read.rpath.params(Cbase2, Cdiet2)
  CalCur_unbal2[[i]][[1]] <- CalCur_unbal2[[i]][[1]] %>%
    select(-X)
  CalCur_unbal2[[i]][[1]][93, 5] <- NA
  CalCur_unbal2[[i]][[1]][CalCur_unbal2[[i]][[1]] == -1] <- NA
   CalCur_unbal2[[i]][[2]] <- CalCur_unbal2[[i]][[2]] %>%
    select(-X)

  check.rpath.params(CalCur_unbal2[[i]])
}


```
 
#Creating a balanced Ecopath model 
```{r}
for (i in 1:500) {
Cal_bal[[i]] <- rpath(CalCur_unbal[[i]]) 
  cbind(Cal_bal[[i]]$Group, Cal_bal[[i]]$EE)
  cbind(Cal_bal[[i]]$Group, Cal_bal[[i]]$TL) 
}
```

#Creating base scenario 
```{r}
 #Define different functional groups
  all_species <- Cal_bal$Group[1:92] 
  mammals <- Cal_bal$Group[71:85] 
  seabirds <- c(Cal_bal$Group[60:70], Cal_bal$Group[86:92])
  pred_fish  <- Cal_bal$Group[33:59] 
  forage <- Cal_bal$Group[19:27]

  for (i in 1:500) {
  yearlist = 2001:2050

base_sim_scene[[i]] <- rsim.scenario(Cal_bal[[i]], CalCur_unbal[[i]], years = yearlist)
scene0[[i]] <- base_sim_scene[[i]]
run0[[i]] <- rsim.run(scene0[[i]], method='AB', years=yearlist) 
#rsim.plot(run0[[i]], all_species) #This isn't working
  }


```

#End biomass
```{r}
end_biomass <- function(rsim){return(rsim$out_Biomass[dim(rsim$out_Biomass)[1], 2:(dim(rsim$out_Biomass)[2])])}
end_biomass
```

#25% harvest rate

```{r}
 for (i in 1:500) {
target_sp <- "mesopelagics"
target_F <- 0.25
names(target_F) <- target_sp 

scene6[[i]] <- copy(base_sim_scene[[i]])
run6[[i]] <- rsim.run(scene6[[i]], method = 'AB', years=2001)
for (yr in 2002:2050){
  # stock assessment based on current biomass * error
  # use this if including two species: assessment <- end_biomass(run3)[target_sp] * (runif(2) + 0.5)   
assessment[[i]] <- end_biomass(run6[[i]])[target_sp] * (runif(length(target_sp)) + 0.5) #argument of length 0 means input is of length zero 
assessment[[i]]
  # convert target F * assessment to a total catch 
  catches[[i]] <- target_F * assessment[[i]]
  # apply each catch to each species
  for (sp in target_sp){
    scene6[[i]] <- adjust.fishing(scene6[[i]], "ForcedCatch", sp, yr, value=catches[[i]][sp])
  }
  # run 1 year
  run6[[i]] <- rsim.step(scene6[[i]], run6[[i]], method = 'AB', year.end=yr)  #Says in Rsim document on NOAA github that older versions of Ecosim use AB and new versions use 'RK4', default for Rpath is RK4 but we aren't using it??
}  
}
```
